content: There are no relevant paragraphs provided in the prev_chunk to assist with summarizing the curr_chunk. The Secretary of the Army must report on gravesite discrepancies at Arlington National Cemetery within one year. The report should identify any mislabeled or unoccupied gravesites and propose a plan to address any deficiencies. Additionally, the Comptroller General of the United States will review the management and oversight of contracts related to the cemetery. The United States must submit a report to Congress on the management and oversight of contracts at Arlington National Cemetery, including details on current contracts over the simplified acquisition threshold and contracts for automation of burial operations. The report to Congress will include an assessment of the management and oversight of contracts at Arlington National Cemetery, covering current contracts over the simplified acquisition threshold and contracts for automation of burial operations. It will also evaluate the actions taken in response to Inspector General findings and recommendations. The report will assess the implementation of Army Directive 2010-04 at Arlington National Cemetery, including contract management, technology systems, organizational structure, and compliance with plans. The report will assess compliance with Army Directive 2010-04 at Arlington National Cemetery, including recommendations from the Army National Cemeteries Advisory Commission and the adequacy of current practices for providing information to families of individuals buried there. It will also evaluate the feasibility of transferring jurisdiction of the cemetery. The report will assess compliance with Army Directive 2010-04 at Arlington National Cemetery and the United States Soldiers' and Airmen's Home National Cemetery, including the feasibility of transferring jurisdiction to the Department of Veterans Affairs. It will also evaluate the sharing of jurisdiction between the Department of Defense and the Department of Veterans Affairs. The committees of Congress specified for this assessment are the Committee on Armed Services, the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs. The Secretary of the Army is required to submit reports to Congress on the implementation of Army Directive 2010-04 on the Army National Cemeteries Program. The reports will include assessments of execution and compliance with the directive for the preceding 270 days or year. The specified committees for this assessment are the Committee on Armed Services, the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs, and the Committee on Veterans' Affairs. The Secretary of the Army must report to Congress on the implementation of Army Directive 2010-04 for Arlington National Cemetery, evaluating contract management, information systems, organizational structure, and support for families of those buried there. The Secretary of the Army must report to Congress on the implementation of Army Directive 2010-04 for Arlington National Cemetery, including procedures to detect and correct errors in burials. Reports must be submitted within 270 days of the enactment of this Act, and annually for the next 2 years.
